records.location_details: Incident occurred in the Libyan Search and Rescue Region (SRR) involving a Libyan Coast Security vessel P301 and a migrant boat with approximately 60 people. The mistreatment of a migrant took place on the Libyan Coast Security vessel.

possible_violations.violation_name: Prohibition of torture or cruel, inhuman or degrading treatment or punishment
possible_violations.legal_basis: Article 7 of the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights

possible_violations.violation_name: Principle of disembarkation and delivery to a "place of safety"
possible_violations.legal_basis: Annex 34 of the Resolution MSC.167(78), Guidelines on the Treatment of Persons Rescued at Sea of the International Maritime Organization

records.context_note: A Frontex surveillance aircraft observed a Libyan Coast Security vessel P301 mistreating a migrant during a rescue operation in the Libyan SRR. The migrant was forcibly removed from a boat and beaten with a yellow rope. This incident highlights a pattern of violence by Libyan authorities during rescues and subsequent disembarkation in unsafe places, as Libya cannot be considered a place of safety.
records.evidence_quote: A recording made shows at least two crew members of the Libyan Coast Security vessel mistreating a migrant while forcibly removing him from the migrant boat. ... one crew member hits the lying person with a yellow rope seven times, then passes the rope to another member who hits the victim another five times.
